SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.concurrent

Class TaskProcessorBase

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.concurrent.TaskProcessorBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaskProcessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
TaskProcessorAsync, TaskProcessorDelegating, TaskProcessorEventDriven
public abstract class TaskProcessorBase extends Object implements TaskProcessor
Base class for TaskProcessor implementations.

The class implements the control of the taks processor life cycle using a Phaser instance to make sure the ExecutorService is not shut down before all submitted tasks have completed.

  • Method Details

    • newThreadFactory

      protected final ThreadFactory newThreadFactory()
      Creates a new ThreadFactory for generating threads with customized names. This implementation uses an inner TaskProcessorBase.NamedThreadFactory that appends the task processor's name to each thread's name for easier identification.
      Returns:
      a ThreadFactory instance for creating customized threads

    • getStats

      public TaskProcessorBase.Stats getStats()
      Retrieves the statistics of tasks processed by this task processor.
      Returns:
      a Stats record containing current stats for this processor

    • getState

      public TaskProcessorBase.State getState()
      Retrieves the current state of the task processor.
      Returns:
      the current state of the task processor as a TaskProcessorBase.State enum value.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(Consumer<TaskProcessor> listener)
      Adds a listener that will be notified of task processor events. The listener is stored as a weak reference to prevent memory leaks.
      Parameters:
      listener - a Consumer that accepts a TaskProcessor. The listener will be notified when an event occurs in the task processor.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(Consumer<TaskProcessor> listener)
      Removes the specified listener from the list of listeners.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to be removed

    • ensureOpen

      public void ensureOpen()
      Ensure that the processor has not been shut down, i.e., is accepting tasks.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the processor has been shut down

    • ensureClosed

      public void ensureClosed()
      Ensure that the processor has been shut down.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the processor has not been shut down

    • terminate

      protected void terminate()
      Terminates the task processor by forcefully invoking a termination on the internal Phaser.

      This method forcibly terminates the Phaser instance associated with the task processor.

      Note: Forceful termination may lead to incomplete tasks and unregistered parties.

    • waitForCompletion

      public boolean waitForCompletion(long timeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Description copied from interface: TaskProcessor
      Wait until all submitted tasks have completed or a timeout occurs.
      Specified by:
      waitForCompletion in interface TaskProcessor
      Parameters:
      timeout - the timeout value
      timeUnit - the unit to apply to the timeout value
      Returns:
      true, if all tasks have completed, otherwise false (timeout)
